description.narrative: Increased national capacity to provide access to essential immunization services, which contributes to Immunization. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, strengthened health systems, ensure that children and women have equitable access to and use, improved and quality, high- impact maternal, neonatal and child health interventions and adopt healthy

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased national capacity to provide access to essential immunization services

description.narrative: One out every 3 children is fully immunized with the recommended vaccines within the first year of life; 4 out 10 did not receive any vaccination at all and 3 of 10 children that start vaccination drop out without completing the schedule (MICS 2016/2017) | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Proportion of children aged 12-23 months who received 3 doses of DPT/Penta-containing antigen and first dose of measles antigen (national) and in supported high burden States

actual.value:
2015:Figures mentioned here are from the administrative reports and should be considered with a lot of caution as often largely overestimated due to demographics and data collection and reporting challenges. DPT/Penta3: 96% Measles: 99%
35 States (95%) achieved > 80% DPT3 containing antigen coverage Jan

title.narrative: Months with stockout of DTP containing vaccine at the national level (Target: 0 month)
